sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Some 2,000 people attend a remembrance ceremony for Queen Elizabeth II at St. Paul's Cathedral, and new Prime Minister Liz Truss meets with Charles III.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The UK begins the painful process of saying goodbye to Queen Elizabeth II as Buckingham Palace becomes a centre for mourners across the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia sends more troops to the Kharkiv region as Ukraine continues its counter-offensive there and claims to have liberated 30 settlements.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Some 2,000 people attended the first religious ceremony of remembrance for Queen Elizabeth II at St Paul's Cathedral on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Members of the public took part, as well as leading figures like the Mayor of London, the Prime Minister and the leader of the Labour Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: However, no members of the royal family were present.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There were many words of affection for the late Queen and a truly historic moment when the church sang God Save The King for the first time in 70 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Despite Charles III not being present, his speech was broadcast for the audience.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: I have been brought up to cherish a sense of duty to others and to hold in the greatest respect the precious traditions freedoms and responsibilities of our unique history and our system of parliamentary government as the queen herself did with such unswerving devotion i too now solemnly pledge myself I too now solemnly pledge myself, throughout the remaining time God grants me, to uphold the constitutional principles at the heart of our nation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Before his speech, King Charles III met with the newly elected Prime Minister, Liz Truss.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The death of Queen Elizabeth II comes at a difficult time for Truss and the nation, as they face an energy crisis and soaring inflation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The sound of cannon fire echoes across London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: 96 shots, one round for each year of Queen Elizabeth's life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A day like no other, befitting of a queen like no other.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At Buckingham Palace, now a focus of the grief and mourning of an entire nation, thousands gathered as if to believe she was really gone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: She's been an amazing figure in our history. fel os oedd hi'n credu ei bod hi wedi mynd. Mae hi wedi bod yn ffigwr anhygoel yn ein hanes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Nid oedd hi wedi dewis gwneud y swydd hwn, ond mae hi wedi gwneud y gorau peth i'w wneud i'r diwedd.

sentences.sentence: Mae'n swnio'n rhyfeddol oherwydd nad ydw i wedi cwrdd Ã¢ hi, ond, ie, fe wnes i ei chael fel dyn ddwyfeddol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Fe wnes i'n teimlo y gallai hi'n ei gwyboda fel eich mab.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Mae'n ffrind. nice woman who you can, I don't know, you just felt like you could trust her like your grandma.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: You knew it was coming, obviously she was quite elderly and had been unwell for a little while but you just didn't want it to happen I think and so there's just a real loss of somebody who's such a global figurehead and a wonderful presence for us all but I think it's about sadness but also celebration and reflection on everything that she did do and why she was so well regarded globally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: To many, Elizabeth II personified what it was to be British. A model, a steady symbol in an ever-changing world. A monarch who lived for the job and who brought dignity and decency to it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I've just always admired her and what she's done for the her country, the commonwealth and the world. She's been an amazing example of dedication and for the children to see someone who's so dedicated is amazing and I just feel like everybody keeps saying that they're shocked by how sad they are.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: She's been a part of everybody's life for so many.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So it's just a moment in time and it's one to celebrate her.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A part of people's life, a momentous chapter in this country's history, has now come to an end.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Leaving thousands with an unprecedented and disorienting sense of loss that will take some time to process.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Annelies Borge is in London for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Few Britons know life without Queen Elizabeth at the head of the monarch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Her reign spans several generations, very different historical periods, times of war, peace, economic crisis and prosperity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: But in all circumstances, her sense of duty was felt throughout the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: She was a constant in the nation's life, ever inspirational, ever someone who in 1947 had made an oath to serve all her life and did so so brilliantly for Britain and the Commonwealth which she nurtured so uniquely. It was very special to her.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The role of the monarchy in the 21st century has become a topic of debate, but royalists ensure that Queen Elizabeth carried out her duties and was loved in the 15 countries she oversaw.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The Queen wished King Charles to succeed her as its head and he will and this was a particular success, a particular triumph, the way she and Commonwealth leaders had a special relationship. Very often she'd known them since early times when the nation had become independent and of course she had her constitutional duties which she performed so expertly in Britain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Queen Elizabeth II set the bar high for her successor. Those on the streets now are mourning her loss, but her legacy will remain on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Russia is sending more troops to the Kharkiv region as Ukraine continues its counter-offensive

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: there. And Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is claiming big progress, saying as of today the armed forces of Ukraine have liberated and taken control of more than 30 settlements in the Kharkiv region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In some villages there, security and safety checks are ongoing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We are gradually taking control of new settlements. We are returning the Ukrainian flag and protection to our citizens everywhere." Many areas in the Kharkiv region had been occupied by Russia since the beginning of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Moscow's latest military move, their rockets were fired into civilian areas of Kharkiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: According to Kyiv, at least 14 people, including children, were injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And in Zaporizhia, there is still alarm regarding attacks on the nuclear power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Shelling has caused a complete blackout in Ergodar and compromised the safety operation of the nearby Zaporizhia nuclear power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: There is now a low chance that reliable off-site power can be restored. The shelling is putting in danger operators and their families, making it difficult to adequately staff the plant. Together, this has significantly increased the risk of a nuclear accident.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Director General of the International Atomic Energy Agency, Rafael Grossi, has called for a safety zone around the plant and offered his agency's help in implementing it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Faced with the need to keep electricity prices under control,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Europe is opening the doors to imposing a levy on the extra revenues of energy companies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's the idea that got the most consensus during an extraordinary meeting of EU energy ministers in Brussels Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The levy could apply to companies with lower production costs, like renewables, but also for some fossil fuel companies, which will be required to pay a solidarity contribution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The idea is to use the extra money to help the most vulnerable citizens and companies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We need to make sure that we will not let down our citizens and businesses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: When Putin started his energy war, he expected to divide us and damage our democratic societies and economies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He did and will not succeed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Controversy swirled in Brussels on Friday, though, around the idea of putting a price cap on gas imports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Italy wants to apply one to all incoming gas, saying that 15 countries support the idea. But the majority, including the European Commission, prefer to apply a cap only to Russian pipeline gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We have to take care that we will not jeopardize our security supply situation. The LNG market is a global market. We are not among the three biggest LNG importing regions or countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And there is a very strong competition at the LNG market.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And right now it is important that we can replace the decrease in Russian volumes with alternative suppliers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: One thing all member states did agree on though was the need to reduce electricity demand in a coordinated manner. But it's still not clear if this will be done on a compulsory or a voluntary basis. The European Commission will present a new legislative proposal on the matter next week. Christopher Pichazzier, Euronews, Brussels.
